title: Essex lorry deaths: Police to hold driver for another 24 hours
text:

The driver of a lorry in which 39 dead bodies were found on Wednesday morning will be held for questioning for a further 24 hours, police announced.

Mo Robinson will remain in Essex Police custody for a further day following his arrest yesterday morning.

The 25-year-old Northern Irish man was detained after a lorry was found on a Grays industrial estate containing 39 bodies.

The force has obtained a warrant to continue questioning Mr Robinson until tomorrow.

Essex Police said: "Detectives investigating the murder of 39 people in Grays have secured a warrant of further detention from local magistrates at Basildon for a 25-year-old man from Northern Ireland.

(Image: Humphrey Nemar)

(Image: PA)

"The man, a lorry driver, has been arrested on suspicion of murder and will now remain in custody for up to an additional 24 hours."

Deputy Chief Constable Pippa Mills said: "This is an incredibly sensitive and high-profile investigation, and we are working swiftly to gather as full a picture as possible as to how these people lost their lives.

"Our recovery of the bodies is ongoing and the post-mortem and identification processes, which will be lengthy and complex, can then begin.

"Our number one priority is the preserving the dignity of the 39 people who have died and ensuring that we get answers for their loved ones."

(Image: Eastnews Press Agency)

It was reported today that the people found dead in the back of the lorry were Chinese nationals.

Eight of them were women and 31 of them were men.

A friend claimed Mr Robinson was innocent, telling MailOnline: "(Mo) wouldn’t have known those people were in the back.

"Apparently he’d parked up at the industrial estate in Essex and had gone to fetch the paperwork from a pocket on the inside of the lorry door.

"When he opened the container up and saw all the dead bodies, he was absolutely horrified - as anyone would be - and called the ambulance service who in turn alerted the police."

Sources told the Telegraph it is "very unlikely" Robinson knew about any alleged plans to smuggle migrants into the UK.

Police were investigating a suspected Irish people-smuggling ring, the report claimed.
description: The 25-year-old who was arrested yesterday in Grays, Essex will be held by the police for a further 24 hours
